amendatorysection.chaptername: Decedents' Estates; Protection Of Persons And Property
amendatorysection.catchline: Death, resignation, or removal of conservator.
amendatorysection.para: The court may remove a conservator for good cause, upon notice and hearing, or accept the resignation of a conservator. After his death, resignation or removal, the court may appoint another conservator on such notice as the court may direct. A conservator so appointed succeeds to the title and powers of his predecessor.

annotation.para: The court sets forth the grounds for "good cause" to remove a conservator. In re Conservatorship of Estate of Marsh, 5 Neb. App. 899, 566 N.W.2d 783 (1997).
